articles.headline: The Trouble With Markets for Carbon
articles.snippet: As the United States moves toward taking action on global warming, practical experience with carbon markets in the European Union raises the question if such systems ever work.
articles.abstract: As the United States moves toward taking action on global warming, practical experience with carbon markets in the European Union raises the question if such systems ever work.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS  As the United States moves toward taking action on global warming, practical experience with carbon markets in the European Union raises a critical question: Will such systems ever work?

articles.headline: Obama, in Shift, Says He’ll Reject Public Financing
articles.snippet: Barack Obama’s decision to break a pledge to use public money will likely transform presidential campaigns, raising doubts about the future of public financing.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama’s decision to break a pledge to use public money will likely transform presidential campaigns, raising doubts about the future of public financing.
articles.lead_paragraph: Citing the specter of attacks from independent groups on the right, Senator Barack Obama announced Thursday that he would opt out of the public financing system for the general election.
articles.byline: By Michael Luo and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Prosecutors Build Bear Stearns Case on E-Mails
articles.snippet: The indictments are the first to be brought against top Wall Street executives linked to the tight credit market.
articles.abstract: The indictments are the first to be brought against top Wall Street executives linked to the tight credit market.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the spring of 2007, as the mortgage market came unglued, two Bear Stearns executives shared their growing fears in a series of e-mail messages to each other about the perilous condition of the giant hedge funds they oversaw.

articles.headline: China Presses Injured Athletes in Quest for Gold
articles.snippet: Pressured by the nation’s athletic system, China’s Olympic aspirants are pushing themselves to their limits.
articles.abstract: Pressured by the nation’s athletic system, China’s Olympic aspirants are pushing themselves to their limits.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  When China’s champion 10-meter platform diver suffered a detached retina while training, a year after winning a gold medal in the 2004 Athens Olympics, family members and fans speculated about the imminent end of a great career.

articles.headline: In Bear Stearns Case, Question of an Asset’s Value
articles.snippet: The arrest of two former Bear Stearns managers spotlights the vexing problem of how to assign value to tricky assets.
articles.abstract: The arrest of two former Bear Stearns managers spotlights the vexing problem of how to assign value to tricky assets.
articles.lead_paragraph: How much is your investment worth?

articles.headline: Trade Now Could Cost Broker Later
articles.snippet: It used to be that the only brokers accused of ignoring sell orders were the penny stock pump-and-dump operators. This time it is different.
articles.abstract: It used to be that the only brokers accused of ignoring sell orders were the penny stock pump-and-dump operators. This time it is different.
articles.lead_paragraph: Did you ever hear of a broker who would not agree to earn a commission? Even if getting the money required absolutely no work at all?

articles.headline: High Fuel Costs Are Squeezing Low Air Fares
articles.snippet: Jet fuel costs are leading low-fare airlines to raise some fares and alter themselves to appeal to business travelers.
articles.abstract: Jet fuel costs are leading low-fare airlines to raise some fares and alter themselves to appeal to business travelers.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, Southwest Airlines and JetBlue operated under self-imposed fare caps, promising travelers that no ticket would cost more than $299 one way.

articles.headline: Ex-UBS Banker Pleads Guilty in Tax Evasion
articles.snippet: In his plea, Bradley C. Birkenfeld agreed to cooperate with prosecutors in their investigation of UBS practices, which may reveal the names of scores of wealthy American clients.
articles.abstract: In his plea, Bradley C. Birkenfeld agreed to cooperate with prosecutors in their investigation of UBS practices, which may reveal the names of scores of wealthy American clients.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla.  One after another, the secrets spilled out. The millions stashed in Swiss bank accounts. The precious jewels and artwork whisked into hiding. The diamonds smuggled in a tube of toothpaste.

articles.headline: Fugitive Fund Manager’s Girlfriend Is Charged
articles.snippet: The girlfriend of Samuel Israel III, the fugitive former manager of the Bayou hedge fund, was charged with aiding and abetting his flight.
articles.abstract: The girlfriend of Samuel Israel III, the fugitive former manager of the Bayou hedge fund, was charged with aiding and abetting his flight.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities have arrested a suspect in the disappearance of Samuel Israel III, the fugitive former manager of the Bayou hedge fund who they say faked his suicide on the day he was to report to prison last week and is now believed to be on the run.

articles.headline: At Yahoo, the Exodus Continues
articles.snippet: The trickle of departing senior executives has turned into a flood since Yahoo’s talks with Microsoft ended and it signed a search deal with Google.
articles.abstract: The trickle of departing senior executives has turned into a flood since Yahoo’s talks with Microsoft ended and it signed a search deal with Google.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  For more than two years, executives and other senior employees have been leaving Yahoo at a steady, persistent trickle.
